intro: Daviesia campephylla, commonly known as the mountain daphne, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open forests and heathlands. It produces small, leathery leaves and has a bushy growth habit. Daviesia campephylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions.
